# Boulderz Climbing Centre - Etobicoke

## Basic Information
- **Provider**: Boulderz Climbing Centre
- **Location**: 80 The East Mall, Unit 9, Etobicoke, ON M8Z 5X1
- **Website**: boulderzclimbing.com
- **Phone**: (416) 255-6676
- **Email**: etobicokebooking@boulderzclimbing.com

### Manual
- **Transit accessible**: Yes (near Islington station area)
- **Parking**: Available (plaza parking)

## Programs Offered
### Summer Camp (Ages 6-14)
- **Ages**: 6-14
- **Dates available**: Weekly sessions throughout July and August
- **Hours**: 9:00am - 4:00pm (drop-off 8:30am, pickup by 4:30pm)
- **Description**: Climbing-focused day camp with 3-4 hours of climbing daily. Includes arts & crafts, movement programming (yoga, stretching), games, park/splash pad visits. Specialty activities: rappelling, ascending, slacklining. Groups of 6-12 by age/skill. Friday pizza lunch included.

### March Break Camp (Ages 6-12)
- **Ages**: 6-12
- **Dates available**: March break week
- **Hours**: 9:00am - 4:00pm
- **Description**: Same format as summer camp. Full-week booking only.

### PA Day Camp (Ages 6-12)
- **Ages**: 6-12
- **Dates available**: Select PA days
- **Hours**: 9:00am - 4:00pm
- **Description**: Single-day climbing camp on PA days.

## Quality Indicators
- **Certifications**: Needs verification (Ontario day camp regulations apply)
- **Staff ratios**: 1:6 (camper to counsellor)
- **Staff training**: Needs verification (climbing instructor qualifications, first aid)
- **Years operating**: 10+ years (established ~2014, 3 GTA locations)
- **Reviews/reputation**: 4.7/5 Google Reviews (600+ reviews). Parents praise knowledgeable staff and beginner-friendly environment. Some concerns about supervision during open-climb sessions (not camp-specific).

## Logistics
- **Registration status**: Open (registration opened Feb 5, 2026)
- **Registration deadline**: Rolling; popular weeks fill quickly
- **Cancellation policy**: All payments non-refundable. Store credit with 14+ days written notice. 50% store credit with less than 14 days. No makeup days.
- **What to bring**: Water bottle, clean indoor running shoes, socks, comfortable clothing, change of clothes, lunch & snacks (all labeled), sunscreen, hat
- **Allergy policy**: Needs verification
- **Inclusion support**: Needs verification

## Suitability
- **Good fit for**: Children interested in climbing, physical activity, and adventure sports. Ages 6-14.
- **Concerns**: No before/after care (9am-4pm only; pickup by 4:30pm). Full-week bookings only for summer (no single-day). Non-refundable payments. Equipment rental adds ~$60/week if child doesn't own gear. 2026 pricing unconfirmed.
- **Overall rating**: Good option (specialty camp)

## Notes
- Three GTA locations (Etobicoke, Toronto/Dupont, Mississauga) â€” same camp program
- LIT (Leader in Training) volunteer program available for ages 12-17
- Full-week-only policy means this cannot fill single PA day gaps
- Confirm 2026 pricing directly before committing
- No extended care means parents need flexibility for 9am drop-off and 4pm pickup
